speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: Previously on The X-Files:

speaker: SKINNER
line: Amber Lynn LaPierre. The kidnapping in Sacramento, California.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're personalizing this case. You're identifying with your sister.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: That little girl in California-- you're out there, aren't you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. I am.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Call when you get back, Fox.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, your mom's dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She killed herself.

speaker: KATHY LEE TENCATE
line: Your mother knew, didn't she? She'd seen them. The walk-ins. Old souls looking for new homes. Your sister's among them.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been looking for my sister in the wrong place. That's what my mother was trying to tell me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're under arrest.

speaker: MULDER
line: They said the birds refused to sing and the thermometer fell suddenly as if God Himself had His breath stolen away. No one there dared speak aloud, as much in shame as in sorrow. They uncovered the bodies one by one. The eyes of the dead were closed as if waiting for permission to open them. Were they still dreaming of ice cream and monkey bars? Of birthday cake and no future but the afternoon? Or had their innocence been taken along with their lives buried in the cold earth so long ago? These fates seemed too cruel, even for God to allow. Or are the tragic young born again when the world's not looking? I want to believe so badly; in a truth beyond our own hidden and obscured from all but the most sensitive eyes...

speaker: MULDER
line: In the endless procession of souls... in what cannot and will not be destroyed. I want to believe we are unaware of God's eternal recompense and sadness. That we cannot see His truth. That that which is born still lives and cannot be buried in the cold earth. But only waits to be born again at God's behest... where in ancient starlight we lay in repose.

speaker: TAGLINE
line: BELIEVE TO UNDERSTAND

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ed Truelove was 19 when he committed his first murder. He was working as a janitor at an elementary school and they needed someone to play Santa Claus. He never got over the feelings it aroused. He's admitted to all of it, Mulder. 24 separate murders. But he refuses to take blame for Amber Lynn LaPierre. I was just handed the preliminary forensics report. Her body was not one of those found in the graves. Mulder, I know you wanted to find her out there.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's got hours of video of her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm talking about your sister. I know that's who you're looking for.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. You don't know how badly I wanted her to be in one of those graves. As hard as it is to admit, I wanted to find her here riding her bike like all these other kids. I guess I just want it to be over.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Agent Mulder, Scully, there's a Mr. Harold Piller here to see you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Piller?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: Agent Mulder. Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do we know each other?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: Not personally, but I'm happy to meet you. Hi. Harold Piller.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Piller, are you part of this investigation?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: Yes, I hope to be.

speaker: MULDER
line: How can we help you?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I was hoping to help you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're a police psychic.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: My references are on the back. I've gotten some... strong hits off this case. You're looking for a little girl but she's not among the dead. Your suspect is going to say he didn't kill her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did he?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: No. I think I can help find her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Piller, you have some interesting references here. You've, uh, worked with law enforcements in Kashmir, India, Myanmar, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Khyber Pass...

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: That was a train wreck. A horrible tragedy. They called me in to locate the bodies of seven children who were unrecovered.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And did you recover them?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I didn't recover them, no. But I explained what happened.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: The children's bodies... were transported from the accident site by a spiritual intervention-- what are known as "walk-ins."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you, Mr. Piller, but we have real work to be done.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I've studied this phenomenon the world over. It-it... Mudslides in Peru, earthquakes in Uzbekistan... Kids' bodies never found, never accounted for in any other way.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened to them?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: The bodies were transported from the various sites in starlight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Please excuse us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... Mulder, please.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you have been through so much in such a short time -- the death of your mother and the feelings it's brought up for your sister -- you're vulnerable right now.

speaker: MULDER
line: We still have a missing body -- Amber Lynn LaPierre -- she may be alive -- we don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, but this man isn't going to help us find her by his own admission.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's not the first time I've heard what he's saying. About the intervention of these walk-in spirits? Kathy Lee Tencate mentioned it to me in prison. She said that's what took her son.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because it's foolproof, Mulder. Nobody is going to disprove it if there's no body. I mean, that's exactly what this man does. He gives a, a comforting explanation that a train wreck or an earthquake that everyone can live with but the fact is the bodies are still buried.

speaker: MULDER
line: Or maybe they "are" somewhere else.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like your sister. Mulder... You told me that all you wanted was for this to be over.

speaker: MULDER
line: I do.... I do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, then I'm going back to Washington. There's nothing more to be done here.

speaker: (CLOSED CAPTIONED)  HAROLD PILLER
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: How long have you been doing this?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: A few years. I have a son who disappeared... under strange circumstances. He's never been found. And then one day I just, uh... started to see them.

speaker: MULDER
line: These walk-ins-- you say they come and take the children. Why?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: In almost every case the parents had a precognitive image of their child dead. Horrible visions. I believe what this is, is the work of good spirits. Foretelling their fates. The fate the child was about to meet. A particularly violent fate that wasn't meant to be... which is why the spirits intervene transforming matter into pure energy. Starlight. But it's not what happened here.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know that?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: Because these children... all died suffering. Pleading innocently for their lives. These beautiful children, so... trusting and pure. I see them. My God, why? Why must some suffer and not others?

speaker: MULDER
line: You see them. Do you see Amber Lynn LaPierre?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: She wasn't here. She never was. But I'm... I'm sensing a connection with her... to this place. It... No, it's a connection to... It's a connection to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's that?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: You lost someone close to you. A young girl. It happened a... a long time ago. A sister. There's a connection between these girls, isn't there? Between her and Amber Lynn.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is the connection?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I don't know. But we're going to find them. I'm sure of it.

speaker: WERBER
line: I'm going to count backwards now, Fox. And you'll fall into a deep, relaxed state so that you remember all about your sister and what happened.

speaker: 1989 MULDER
line: nan

speaker: 1989 MULDER
line: I'm at home, at my Mom and Dad's. We're in the den playing a game.

speaker: 1989 WERBER
line: Who are you there with?

speaker: 1989 MULDER
line: Samantha.

speaker: 1989 WERBER
line: Do you feel in any danger?

speaker: 1989 MULDER
line: No. We're arguing, you know but not really-- just playing the game. You know, fooling around.

speaker: AGENT SCHONIGER
line: By what I can tell from the tape he seems to be in a legitimate hypnotic state.

speaker: 1989 MULDER
line: ...a little afraid. The pieces on the board have fallen off and...

speaker: AGENT SCHONIGER
line: Here I became suspicious.

speaker: 1989 MULDER
line: Samantha?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Suspicious of what?

speaker: AGENT SCHONIGER
line: In 30 years with the FBI, you'd think you've seen it all. I sometimes think I have. But this is just garden-variety compensatory abduction fantasy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Compensatory for what?

speaker: AGENT SCHONIGER
line: His guilt, his fear... everything that's preventing Agent Mulder from remembering the truth about what really happened that night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean his sister wasn't abducted.

speaker: AGENT SCHONIGER
line: No, the sister definitely went missing in 1973. That's not in dispute. Agent Mulder, however, wasn't regressed until 1989. See, his delusion is playing into his unconscious hope that his sister is still alive...and if you think about it, his delusion has the effect of giving a reason to pursue her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But why alien abduction?

speaker: AGENT SCHONIGER
line: Close Encounters, E.T., who knows? But there was probably a lot of imagery collecting in his head in those 16 years and then he comes down here and he finds the X-Files.

speaker: [TD NOTE
line: Just a thought. Remember "Unusual Suspects"? Those events took place in May, 1989, a month before Mulder's regression therapy. As was speculated at the time, perhaps the alien imagery came from the gas he was subjected to back then.]

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what do you think happened to his sister?

speaker: AGENT SCHONIGER
line: Well, in 1973, we were pretty damned unsophisticated about violent, predatory crime. My guess is she was kidnapped in the house, her body was disposed of, never found.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think that his sister's dead?

speaker: AGENT SCHONIGER
line: Have you seen this file? There was an extraordinary amount of effort put into finding his sister. Even the Treasury Department got involved. His father worked at a high level in the government. They found nothing. Why, Agent Scully? Why do you want to bring all this back up now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Someone owes it to Mulder.

speaker: AGENT SCHONIGER
line: Word of advice, me to you: Let it be. You know, there's some wounds that are just too painful ever to be reopened.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, this particular wound has never healed. And Mulder deserves closure, just like anyone.

speaker: CHARLTON HESTON
line: Apes evolved from men? There's got to be an answer.

speaker: APE
line: Don't look for it, Taylor. You may not like what you find.

speaker: APE
line: Untie me!

speaker: MULDER
line: What? What are you doing?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I'm picking up something.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's 3:00 in the morning.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: There's someone here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, the TV is on.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: No. A visitor.

speaker: APE
line: Lieutenant! Fetch our explosives. We've got to seal off the cave.

speaker: APE LIEUTENANT
line: Yes, sir!

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: They... they want to speak. They want to tell us something.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: APE
line: You will both stand trial for heresy.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: Get a piece of paper.

speaker: APE
line: In a few minutes there will be no...

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: And a pen.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: No, you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Shoot.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: It's your mother. She's here in the room with us. She's trying to speak to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does she say?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: She wants to tell you about your sister. Where she is.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is she saying? Harold?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I don't know. I... She's gone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Harold.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I lost her.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's crap. You're full of crap.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get out of here.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I'm telling you...

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm telling you. I never should have listened to you.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: She was here. She had a message.

speaker: MULDER
line: Please go.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: Look.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who wrote that?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: You did.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. I found something, and I'm standing here not quite believing what it is.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know if you know this but there was a special Treasury Department investigation into Samantha's disappearance.

speaker: MULDER
line: In 1973. I know all about that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I'm in your mother's house and I found a piece of a document that she burned -- a document that matches one that I found in the treasury investigation file. But she had the original, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't see where you're going with this, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is the document that effectively calls off the search for your sister, Mulder. And it's signed with the initials "C.G.B.S."

speaker: SCULLY
line: C.G.B. Spender. The Smoking Man. He was involved with this back in '73.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that's not exactly a revelation, Scully. He was a friend of my father's.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you told me you believe that he's the man that killed your father. That he's the man who's done nothing but confound your work. Who's come close to killing you and here he's ordering people to stop looking for your sister.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't see what you think this proves or how you think it's gonna help me find her now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't want to press him?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's a dead end. He's never been of any help and he's not going to be of any help now. Look, I'm pursuing this my own way, all right? I got to go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not exactly the end of the rainbow, is it, Harold?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: There's something here. I'm getting a strong sense of it. I think we should have a look.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've had a look.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: What are you afraid of? That you'll really find her? That you'd have to deal with it?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's nothing here. It's a decommissioned base.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: You wrote the name down yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why do you care so much about what I feel? Why is it so important to you?

speaker: GUARD
line: You gentlemen need to move along. I have to ask you to turn around and get back in your car. There's nothing to see here.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: There is something here to see, Agent Mulder. I'm sure of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MAN'S VOICE
line: I should've grabbed it for you.

speaker: CSM
line: I like to make myself useful.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You can start by putting out that cigarette.

speaker: CSM
line: Got it all figured out, don't you, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: All but why you can't just come to the door and knock.

speaker: CSM
line: I did that. No one answered.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're sick.

speaker: CSM
line: I had an operation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you want?

speaker: CSM
line: I want you to stop looking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've wanted that since 1973... when you ordered an end to the search for Agent Mulder's sister. Your initials are on that document.

speaker: CSM
line: Yes, I signed that order because I knew then

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why not?

speaker: CSM
line: Because I believe she's dead. No reason to believe otherwise.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're a liar. If you knew that she was dead why didn't you say something earlier? Why now?

speaker: CSM
line: There was so much to protect before. It's all gone now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you just let Mulder believe that she was alive for all these years.

speaker: CSM
line: Out of kindness, Agent Scully. Allow him his ignorance. It's what gives him hope.

speaker: MULDER
line: My sister was here?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: In one of these houses? Where?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I've lost it, whatever it was.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which house, Harold? Come on, which house?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Harold, we don't have all night. Come on, which house was it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go, Harold.

speaker: MULDER
line: You were right. This was the house.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: How do you know?

speaker: MULDER
line: Look.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I told you. What did I tell you?

speaker: MULDER
line: You told me she was here. You didn't say with who.

speaker: SCULLY
line: When did you come up with this story, Mulder? Because yesterday, when I spoke to you, you said that the Smoking Man wasn't involved.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, it turns out you were right, Scully. He had every reason to call off the hunt for my sister. After her abduction, she was returned to him and he raised her at the military base along with his son, Jeffrey Spender.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I saw her name in the cement. Her handprints, right next to his.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I spoke to him. The Smoking Man, C.G.B. Spender, whatever his name is...

speaker: MULDER
line: You went to him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He told me that she was dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, well... he's a liar.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, why would he lie now? I mean, think about it. It hurts me to tell you this.

speaker: MULDER
line: The handprints prove he's a liar! I saw her handprints in the cement. Her name, Samantha, right underneath them. How more obvious can it be? Harold Piller led me there. He led me right to them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, he led you, Mulder. He led you from the moment that he met you.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: Something wrong?

speaker: MULDER
line: Sit down, Harold.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: Hi. You're back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Scully has informed me that you failed to mention something to me when we first met.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: That you're currently the subject of a criminal investigation into the murder of your son.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: My son was taken from me. The police need someone to blame.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not all, Harold. Your history of mental illness. You were institutionalized, diagnosed with schizophrenia.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I've got that under control. You wouldn't have believed me if I told you any of that. Look what I've shown you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You only tell me what you see.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I came to you because I want to help. You think I'm a fraud. What do I have to gain from this? How am I any different from you? All I want is to find my son. I... I just... I just want my little boy back.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I see these things. I don't know how, but... there has got to be a reason and if it's not to help, what is it? I know your sister is out there. Maybe I can prove it to you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, whoever's lived here hasn't lived here in a long time.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: We're gonna need to hold hands.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I'm going to try and summon their presence into the house.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, yay. A seance. I haven't done that since high school.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe afterwards we can play postman and spin the bottle.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: I'm not going to say anything. I'm just going to be very quiet and still. That's how it seems to work best. Um, you might experience a sudden chill or feel a... a pressure in your ears. That means they're here. And if they need to, they'll let themselves be seen. Close your eyes and let them come to you. They will come to you if you're ready to see.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How will we know?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: Shh. Stay quiet. You'll know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is?

speaker: MULDER
line: There was a boy - he led me into this room.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: It's a diary. It's your sister's.

speaker: MULDER
line: "They did more tests today, but not the horrible kind. I was awake and they made me lay still... while they shined lights in my eyes. They asked me questions, but I always lie now and tell them what they want to hear, just to make them stop. I hate them and I hate the way they treat me... like I'm an old suitcase they can just drag around and open up whenever they want to. They know I hate them, but they don't even care."

speaker: MULDER
line: This is 1979. She's 14 years old here. 14 years old.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Sometimes I think my memories were taken by the doctors but not all of them. I remember faces. I think I had a brother... with brown hair, who used to tease me. I hope someday he reads this and knows I wish I could see his face for real."

speaker: MULDER
line: And then, uh... she's, uh... talking about running away. She wants to run away so that they stop doing the tests. And then it just stops. "No more. No more tests. No more questions. I'm getting out of here and not turning back. Tonight. Tonight I'm going to run far, far away. I can't let them catch me. They'll kill me if they do. Running for my life, for the rest of my life."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let's get out of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, I never stop to think... that the light is billions of years old by the time we see it. From the beginning of time right past us into the future. Nothing is ancient in the universe. But, maybe they are souls, Scully. Traveling through time as starlight, looking for homes. I wonder what my mother saw. And I wonder what she was trying to tell me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Go get some sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I got it, Mulder. I couldn't believe it when I saw it. It was like it was looking for me. Sergeant's blotter, 1979.

speaker: (IT READS
line: "Approximately 14 year old girl picked up. Runaway claims she was held hostage... hospital for exam." Other names on the document are Patrolman J. Poole and Detective J. Floyd)

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The description matches your sister.

speaker: MULDER
line: When did you find this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's almost noon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe she went by another name. She could have given them a name other than her own.

speaker: MULDER
line: She didn't give a name at all. Read this. It's the medical report. The admittance notes say the E.R. nurses couldn't get her name out of her. Neither could the cops.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Her medical examination is normal. Her mental state -- it says here she was exhibiting signs of paranoia.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Evidence of probable self-inflicted abuse. Including small crescent-shaped scars on her knees, wrists and chest." Those were from the tests, Scully. That's her. She was here. 14 years old, in this hospital.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Diagnosis of condition incomplete... tests unavailable."

speaker: MULDER
line: And he knew. He lied. He knew she was alive and the only reason he's lying now is because she's still alive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, wait.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know. I know. You don't want me to get my hopes up. I understand that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That was 1979. It was 21 years ago. I don't even know where to begin and .. and we don't even have a record here of a doctor signing her out.

speaker: MULDER
line: We have an E.R. nurse who signed her in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's wrong?

speaker: MULDER
line: I have this... powerful feeling and I can't explain it, but that... this is the end of the road. That I've been brought here to learn the truth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you ready for it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you want me to go talk to her myself?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: ARBUTUS RAY
line: I thought that was the door.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Arbutus Ray?

speaker: ARBUTUS RAY
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you the same Arbutus Ray that worked as a nurse at the Dominic Savio Memorial Hospital in 1979?

speaker: ARBUTUS RAY
line: Yes, I'm she.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'd like to ask you about a patient you treated... a 14-year-old girl.

speaker: ARBUTUS RAY
line: I remember, yes. She was such a pretty young girl. You couldn't forget someone like her or how frightened she was. Scared for her sweet life. Deputy brought her in, she was shaking like a leaf. Wouldn't let anyone touch her but me. Then the strangest thing happened...

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: You had a vision of her... dead, like the parents of Amber Lynn LaPierre.

speaker: ARBUTUS RAY
line: No one believed me. Honestly you're the first person who...

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you saw her dead?

speaker: ARBUTUS RAY
line: That night, in her bed I blinked and it was gone. She was sleeping as sound as could be. I don't know why but it made some kind of strange sense.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: ARBUTUS RAY
line: There were men. They came to pick her up late that night. I assumed the one was her father but he gave me such a chill when he looked at me when I asked him would he please put out his cigarette.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So they took her?

speaker: ARBUTUS RAY
line: They meant to but when I took them to her room she was gone. Disappeared out of a locked room. Just vanished.

speaker: MULDER
line: Samantha.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, where did you go?

speaker: MULDER
line: End of the road.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's okay. It's okay.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: My son? You saw my son?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's dead. They're all dead, Harold. Your son, Amber Lynn, and my sister.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Harold, you see so much but you refuse to see him. You refuse to let him go. But you have to let him go now, Harold. He's protected. He's in a better place. They're all in a better place. We both have to let go, Harold.

speaker: HAROLD PILLER
line: You're wrong. I'm going to find him. I don't believe you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what happened? Are you sure you're all right?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm free.
